body:
> Aside: why is this all so slow? Is it Plan 9, Go on Plan 9, or Plan 9 on GCE that's slow?

The Plan 9 file systems are usually slow, but this is amplified in virtual environments.

> @0intro, I'll buy you a beer in compensation for the n1-highcpu-2.

Thanks. I hope it will be a good American IPA :-)

> Was starting all the processors (it's not automatic?) the solution that
> makes the runtime tests fast enough to finish in under 2 minutes?

Only the first processor is enabled by default, because it could
cause issues on some machines. Since it seems to work fine,
I've removed `*nomp=` from the plan9.ini.

I'm not sure it's enough to get rid of that issue however.
